Information: This represents emissions from enteric fermentation, primarily occuring in multigastric ruminant livestock (including buffalo, camels, cattle, goats, and sheep)
Notes: FAO: buffaloes, camels, cattle dairy, cattle non dairy, goats, horses, llamas,  mules, sheep.
FAO: buffaloes, camels, cattle dairy, cattle non dairy, chickens broilers, chickens layers,  goats, horses, llamas, mules, sheep

Information: This represents the per-animal nitrus oxide (:math:`\text{N}_2\text{O}`) emissions from manure management
Data Link: `Manure Management (N2O) data on Google Drive <FAO: N2O Manure Management: buffaloes, camels, cattle dairy, cattle non dairy, chickens broilers, chickens layers,  goats, horses, llamas, mules, sheep  https://drive.google.com/file/d/1dEJ81FMVPG-_W_mkZcMiIPhggYMPzrI6/view?usp=sharing>`_

Information: Used to allocate grassland to grazing animals and estimate carrying capacity under the assumption that the distribution of livestock across grazelands is uniform, grasslands are homogenous, and that there is no mixed grazing (though this could be implemented as a policy parameter). Model parameter that should be constant (only first year is used). Livestock that are non-grazing (e.g. pigs and chickens) should have a value of 0 for this variable.
Reference: Numbers in pounds from Table 5, `Holechek 1988 <https://journals.uair.arizona.edu/index.php/rangelands/article/download/10362/9633>`_. Estimated conversion of 2.2 lbs/kg used to estimate kg.

Information: Initial population of animal; note that only the first value (associated with t = 0) will be used. Future animal populations are estimated using demand elasticities from GDP/Capita.
Notes: FAO: This variable indicates the number of animals of the species present in the country at the time of enumeration.

Information: Estimated as a function of land use, carrying capacity, and the **Carrying Capacity Scalar**.

Variable: Change to Net Imports of Livestock
Information: Difference between livestock demanded and those that can be produced locally.
